page.title: 06 TRADE 1
page.content:
Like many small villages, both {Rowhedge}and{Fingrignhoe}have fewer local shops than in the past as most people prefer to shop at the super & hypermarkets in Colchester. Rowhedge has one butcher, Mr. Evans who has been serving Rowhedge since l937,one greengrocer's London Stores, a branch of the Co-op., while at the Post Office stationery, greetings cards, confectionary, newspapers and periodicals and a limited number of groceries can be bought. {Fingringhoe}is served by a village shop which also includes a sub-Post Office. At{Abberton}there is a bakery and a small shop which also includes a sub-Post Office.
{**************************************
